Package au.edu.anu.omhtk.rng

Class XSRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • au.edu.anu.omhtk.rng.XSRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class XSRandom
extends java.util.Random

    Implementation of George Marsaglia's elegant Xorshift random generator (2003), 30% faster and better quality than the built-in Random. Code imported from there. It generates random numbers using a single seed and just 3 shifts and XOR operations.

    This class is a descendant of the Random class. An instance of this class is used to generate a stream of pseudo-random numbers.

    Author:
    Ian Davies - Dec 8, 2018
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • XSRandom

        public XSRandom()
        Creates a new pseudo random number generator. The seed is initialized to the current time, as if by setSeed(System.currentTimeMillis());.

      • XSRandom

        public XSRandom​(long seed)
        Creates a new pseudo random number generator, starting with the specified seed, using setSeed(seed);.
        Parameters:
        seed - the initial seed

    • Method Detail

      • getSeed

        public long getSeed()
        Returns the current state of the seed, can be used to clone the object

      • setSeed

        public void setSeed​(long seed)
        Sets the seed for this pseudo random number generator. As described above, two instances of the same random class, starting with the same seed, produce the same results, if the same methods are called.
        Overrides:
        setSeed in class java.util.Random
        Parameters:
        seed - the new seed

        Returns an XSRandom object with the same state as the original
